text: Stamped from the Beginning: The Definitive History of Racist Ideas in America is a 2016 non-fiction book about race in the United States by Ibram X. Kendi that won the National Book Award for Nonfiction. ==Stamped: Racism, Antiracism, and You== In 2020 Kendi released Stamped: Racism, Antiracism, and You, which "remixed" his original work for a younger audience, in collaboration with young adult writer Jason Reynolds. ==References== ==External Links== * Interview at New Books Network * Interview at Slate *Interview with Kendi on Stamped from the Beginning at the Tucson Festival of Books, March 11, 2017, C-SPAN *Interview with Kendi on Stamped from the Beginning at Printers Row Lit Fest, June 10, 2017, C-SPAN *Interview with Kendi on Stamped from the Beginning at the Busboys and Poets Bookstore, August 29, 2017, C-SPAN Category:2016 non-fiction books Category:English-language books Category:Racism in the United States
